Description: Small pottery lekythos or flask. Intact. Cream clay with orange tint in parts, rather gritty. Broad swelling body with rounded shoulder, small tubular neck with rounded rim-moulding, tiny flat base (wire marks). Tiny handle attached to neck and top of shoulder.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Royal Ontario Museum, Toronto. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Aquired in Egypt ( an old paper tag resembles those on the Naukratis items 212 and 214 but is unmarked) Hayes 1992 p.168 no.216 Same series as Hayes 1992 p.168 no. 212,214-215
Bibliographic references: Hayes 1992 / Greek and Greek-Style Pottery and Plain Pottery in the Royal Ontario Museum; Excluding Black-Figure and Red-Figure Vases (p. 168, no. 216)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (IC.177)
